symptoms.name: Abdominal pain
symptoms.pattern: May be present in cases with disseminated amebiasis

symptoms.name: Diarrhea
symptoms.pattern: May be present in cases with disseminated amebiasis

vital_signs.temperature: Variable, may be normal or elevated (e.g., 38°C)

physical_findings: Difficulty in carrying out simple calculations
Absence of meningeal signs (in some cases)
risk_factors: Infection of the colon by Entamoeba histolytica trophozoites

imaging_findings.nmri: Multiple bilateral cystic lesions containing varying amounts of fluid; ring enhancement after contrast administration; lesions detected in frontal, temporal, and occipital lobes; supra- and infratentorial zones; may mimic neurocysticercosis
imaging_findings.ct_scan: Multiple liver abscesses (in cases with disseminated amebiasis); abscess in the right lower pulmonary lobe (in cases with disseminated amebiasis); small disseminated intraabdominal abscesses (in cases with disseminated amebiasis); pleural effusion (in cases with disseminated amebiasis)

required: Clinical presentation consistent with amebic brain abscess (e.g., altered mental status, focal neurological deficits)
Positive imaging findings (e.g., NMRI showing cystic lesions with ring enhancement)
supportive: Positive immunofluorescence study for the 140 kDa fibronectin receptor of E. histolytica
Positive PCR for E. histolytica in biopsy tissue
Positive visualization of E. histolytica trophozoites in tissue samples
Positive real-time PCR for E. histolytica in tissue or stool samples
History of travel to endemic areas or exposure to contaminated water/food
